alert.note: Alert for GUC100; GUC110; GUC120; Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 06 at 6:25PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE OVER THE WEEKEND... A tropical disturbance, JTWC Invest 95W, centered near 4N148E is drifting toward the west. It is expected to turn northwestward, moving toward Yap over the next few days. Latest model guidance is in better agreement over the expected movement of this system, though they differ on timing and intensity. All models continue to show 95W remaining south of Guam, with the GFS showing heavy showers streaming across the Marianas over the weekend into Monday. Rainfall amounts continue to be difficult to predict, with the ECMWF showing less than 3 inches over Guam and Rota, decreasing northward to less than 1 inch for Saipan and Tinian. The GFS shows amounts between 5 and 7 inches over Tinian and Saipan with amounts in excess of 10 inches for Guam and Rota. Heavy rainfall remains a possibility across the region as 95W strengthens and moves northwest, with amounts of 5 to 7 inches possible with locally heavier amounts. Localized flooding is possible in low-lying and poor drainage areas, while flash flooding will be possible in areas of heaviest rainfall, especially near steep terrain. Residents of the Marianas need to closely monitor this developing situation as watches, advisories and warnings could be issued later in the week. If living near streams and rivers, prepare to move items away from stream and river banks. Make sure storm drains nearby are not clogged, especially in low-lying areas. This outlook will be updated over the next couple of days with additional information, or cancelled if the situation changes.
